DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Participating therapy program may enhance communication intimacy men prostate cancer partner . PURPOSE : This randomized clinical trial study well therapy enhances communication intimacy men early stage prostate cancer partner .
DOC.brief_title: Intimacy-Enhancing Couples ' Intervention Localized Prostate Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: Aim 1 A . To evaluate impact Intimacy-Enhancing Couples ' intervention ( IEC ) versus General Health Wellness Intervention ( GHW ) Usual care control ( UC ) patient partner psychological relationship outcome . B . To determine whether relationship length , pre-intervention relationship satisfaction , men 's pre-intervention masculinity moderate effect IEC couple ' psychological relationship outcome Aim 2 A . To evaluate whether IEC effect couple ' communication intimacy compare GHW UC determine whether change relationship communication intimacy mediate change couple ' psychological relationship outcome . Exploratory Aim : A . To evaluate impact IEC versus GHW physical activity fruit vegetable intake well partner 's support partner 's adoption great physical activity fruit vegetable intake .
DOC.criteria: Patient primary diagnosis localize prostate cancer ( T1 , T2 , N=0 M=0 , T3 N=0 M=0 ) Patient surgery initiate radiation treatment ( brachytherapy external beam radiation ) begin preradiation Androgen deprivation therapy within past 12 month . Patient currently marry live partner , relationship duration least 1 year Patient partner live within 1 hour commute distance recruitment site Patient partner read speak English Patient Impact Events Scale ( IES ) score great equal 16 and/or partner IES score great equal 17 . Patient previous definitive treatment prostate cancer Patient concurrent diagnosis another cancer ( nonmelanoma skin cancer ) Partner diagnose cancer ( nonmelanoma skin cancer ) Patient partner significant hearing impairment
